resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

kou edited a comment on pull request #12419:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12419#issuecomment-1040230412


   Thanks.
   Could you also add the following sample programs written in Vala to `c_glib/example/vala/`?
   
   * A program that uses arrow-glib
   * A program that uses arrow-dataset-glib
   * A program that uses arrow-flight-glib
   * A program that uses gandiva-glib
   * A program that uses parquet-glib


--

fields.description:
We have output the GObject introspection file(.gir) with C_GLib, could we step forward to generate the Vala VAPI file(*.vapi) and install it for GLib(C) packages?

```
vapigen --library Arrow Arrow-1.0.gir.gir
vapigen --library ArrowDataset ArrowDataset-1.0.gir
```

Reference: [Projects/Vala/Bindings - GNOME Wiki!|https://wiki.gnome.org/Projects/Vala/Bindings#Generating_the_VAPI_File]

comments.body:
Interesting.
It seems that we can use {{gnome.generate_vapi()}}: https://mesonbuild.com/Gnome-module.html#gnomegenerate_vapi

Do you want to work on this?
(I'm not a Vala user.)

I've submitted a PR, try to implement this feature:

[Generate vapi for Vala community by taozuhong · Pull Request #12419 · apache/arrow (github.com)|https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12419]
Since it's in progress I'm postponing to 9.0, but would like to see merged eventually since it would be a pretty nice addition!
[Vala PR has merged]([ARROW-15671: [GLib] Add support for Vala · apache/arrow@953a6de (github.com)|https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/953a6ded05dd5f832d2757b1b4eab51cb35349b6])
